comment: His pre-lab work is unnecessarily long. Gave me bad grades on them with no feedback, & is the slowest grader ever. His lectures were fine but spent 2 hrs lecturing & only 1 hr for the actual lab. I didn't like his personality either. Acted condescending & if u make 1 mistake in lab (like forgetting to put on your googles) he gets pretty upset.

DO NOT TAKE. Made the lab hard asf for no reason. The only reason I got an A was because my chem lecture had a great professor. He's super condescending and didn't answer any questions. Refused to help. 0/10

Its a three hour lab but he spends two hours lecturing and only gives an hour to do the actual lab work. He refuses to let anyone stay after class to finish their work, he's even ended class 30+ minutes early on multiple occasions. You better hope you don't have any questions about the lab because he wont answer them.

Personally, I feel like he was just super hard for no reason. Other students I knew who where taking chem lab had professors who really wanted you to learn but I don't feel like he did. If you can take someone else I definitely recommend because he was super hard to work with and bad with feedback.

This was a hard course considering the loads of coursework that came with it but that's the case with any lab. He was pretty funny and outgoing which made the course a lot more tolerating. He can be a bit hard on students but he probably means well. Just make sure you dont wait to do your work right before class, as it will take the entire week.

I thought he was a great lab instructor and very caring. He explained concepts very well and I even learned some stuff from this lab I didn't understand from my chem lecture class. As long as you prepare for each lab and get your work done, you will be fine.

I regret taking him so much! all his effort goes into his beginning labs, and he gets lazy and doesn't explain anything further down. His grading system is never clear as what he expects changes. He also didnt even know the lab we were doing in terms of the procedure. His personality isn't easy to get use to either he can come off as condescending.

Overall it was really hard to get used to him. Before every class take a 10 question quiz over the lab and write a bunch of things that you don't even need in your journal. Also will get angry if you write work on the left side of your journal instead of the right. pretty good lecture wise. grading is strict. Says his average for final was 71%.

I had Mr. Messinger in his first semester teaching at KSU. While there were a few growing pains with grading and getting used to the course, he was pretty fair and by the book. He spent a decent amount of time before the labs lecturing and knew the material enough to help you if needed. A pretty nice guy, just be respectful and work hard.

The lab was not hard. We had to read the lab book and follow the labs written. The problem was when it came to the lab reports. A lot of the grading was all over the place for the entire class; it was kind of hard to know if you were going to pass or fail a lab report even if you used the same amount of effort for each of them.
